isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMPS LUK VT73 AND LF93 - DISASSEMBLE - VT73 ( Figure 6 )

svcproc.title: VT73 ( Figure 6)
svcproc.para: A clean work area is most essential for disassembly. A work bench (6 foot), bench vise (6 inch), cleaning tank and shop air are also useful. Lay clean kraft paper on the work bench for disassembled parts. Place parts in an orderly manner on the kraft paper to avoid mixing the parts during assembly. Discard the shaft seal, O-rings, and gaskets removed during disassembly.

caution.para: Pumps have aluminum housing parts. Care should be taken when handling power steering pump unit to avoid denting and chipping of contact surfaces and sealing areas.

step1.para: Drain the reservoir and clamp pump mounting flange in a bench vise (housing end up), being certain to use protective jaws.
Remove the hexagon plug from the pump body.

warning.para: Special attention should be exercised when working with spring loaded plug. Always wear safety goggles as serious personal injury can result if not properly protected.

step1.para: Remove spring and gently slide out the valve spool. Care should be taken to avoid scratching the valve bore. Do not allow the spring and control valve subassembly to fall from the bore.
Remove four screws from the pump housing. Remove the O-ring and back-up ring. Remove the pressure plate, pins, cam ring, vanes, rotor, wear plate and O-rings from the flange.
